author: Kevin Woodford
method: Place the swede in a pan of cold water and sprinkle in 1 tsp of salt. Bring to the boil and reduce the heat to a slow simmer. Cook for 10 to 15 minutes or until tender. Drain the swede and return to the pan. Mash with a potato masher, stir in the butter, salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste, and serve.
ingredients: 1 swede, peeled and diced,  1 tsp salt,  50g/2oz butter,  salt and freshly ground black pepper
